channel.title: CVE Feed for oceanwp -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for oceanwp -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-49164|2023-12-19T21:41:51.146Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in OceanWP Ocean Extra.This issue affects Ocean Extra: from n/a through 2.2.2.

item.title: CVE-2023-23891|2023-04-06T13:54:38.217Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in OceanWP Ocean Extra plugin <= 2.1.1 versions. Needs the OceanWP theme installed and activated.

item.title: CVE-2023-23700|2024-06-04T17:22:26.494Z -- oceanwp -- oceanwp
item.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in OceanWP allows PHP Local File Inclusion.This issue affects OceanWP: from n/a through 3.4.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-24399|2023-03-30T11:14:55.929Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in OceanWP Ocean Extra plugin <= 2.1.2 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-5531|2024-06-11T14:08:03.181Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: The Ocean Extra plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Flickr widget in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.8 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1277|2024-06-04T17:59:33.662Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: The Ocean Extra plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via custom fields in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-3167|2024-06-04T17:32:16.560Z -- oceanwp -- ocean%20extra
item.description: The Ocean Extra plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘twitter_username’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 2.2.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2476|2024-06-04T17:29:18.202Z -- oceanwp -- oceanwp
item.description: The OceanWP theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the load_theme_panel_pane function in all versions up to, and including, 3.5.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to expose sensitive information such as system/environment data and API keys.
